ResumÉ  

About Me

Hi! My name is Tim Schieber and I am a front end developer based in Kansas City. I've been doing development for the past decade and enjoy the capabilities/challenges that code presents.

Feel free to take a look at my portfolio and drop me a line if you'd like to chat! View all the code for this site on my GitHub.

Quick Look
  • Specialty: HTML/CSS/JavaScript
  • Experience: Agency, Corporate and Contractor
  • Education: Buena Vista University, Storm Lake, IA
  • Notable Clients:
    • BNSF Railway
    • Children's Mercy Hospital
    • HYLA Mobile
    • Garmin
    • Sprint
Notes About Me

I love internet memes, Sporting KC, terrible 80s action movies and sushi. I've been to Japan and would like to travel to Germany.

Nope: Hello
Online Tool
Nope: Hello
Description

Tablet web application to act as contact service in offices. User would choose employee from list on iPad device -- that employee would then be sent an instant message, text message and phone call in sequential order letting them know they have a visitor. Awarded 2nd place at 2013 Rails Rumble. Built in 48 hours with team of four.

Features
  • Made for iPad devices
  • Integrated with Ruby on Rails
http://r13.railsrumble.com/entries/winners

Web application has since been taken down.

Workflow

I've worked with many different workflows and am always up for trying something new. But given the opportunity to define my own, here is what I would use...

Getting Started
  • Mac/PC: Comfortable with both but would prefer a Mac.
  • Brackets: Code editor of choice. Modern, lightweight and lots of plugins.
  • Chrome: Great developer tools.
  • Retina Screen: Love making sites look good in hi res.
  • Node.js: To run things listed in "Development" column.
  • Git: Awesome version control.
Development
  • HTML5: Gotta love those semantic tags.
  • CSS3: Graceful degradation for older IE browsers.
  • Gulp.js: Easy to use task runner.
  • Jade: Amazing templating engine.
  • Sass: CSS to the next level.
  • Harvest: Gulp boilerplate.
  • IcoMoon: Creating icon fonts.
Frameworks/Plugins
  • jQuery: Simplifying JavaScript usage.
  • Bootstrap: Probably just the grid but will pull in other things (i.e. modals) as needed.
  • Animate.css: Add some simple animations.
  • jQuery Validation Plugin: Front end form validation and handling Ajax submission.
  • slick: Highly customizable and wonderfully responsive carousel.

Contact

Feel free to send me a message through my LinkedIn profile. I'll try my best to get back to you as soon as I can.

I am available for freelance opportunities if the project is a good fit.
